segments.source_content:
---
slug: /208
title: "This Week In React #208: Compiler, Next.js, Docusaurus, TanStack, nuqs, Storybook, StyleX, React Navigation, Shopify, Reanimated, Nitro, BottomTabs, CocoaPods, Maestro, Rolldown, Container Queries..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 11-06-2024
---
Hi everyone!
No major React announcements this week, probably due to the US presidential election.

translations.fr: Pas d'annonces majeures de React cette semaine, probablement en raison des Ã©lections prÃ©sidentielles amÃ©ricaines.

segments.source_content: But we still had a bunch of exciting React and React Native and great community articles. I'm particularly excited about the React Compiler direction, and the release of React Navigation 7 with a new screen preloading API. Shopify's React Native endorsement is also great news for our ecosystem. Of course, I'm happy to unveil what I've been working on for months on Docusaurus too!

segments.source_content: Don't forget to answer the [State of React 2024 survey](https://survey.devographics.com/en-US/survey/state-of-react/2024?source=this_week_in_react). It's closing next week, and we still have less answers than last year so far. If you have an audience, please help spread the word, and add a [`?source=my_name` parameter](https://github.com/Devographics/surveys/issues/250#issuecomment-2423485429) so that survey bias can be tracked.

## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![Sathya Gunasekaran - What's next for the React Compiler?](/emails/issues/208/compiler.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qd5yk2gxbtg)

segments.source_content: ğŸ¥ [**Sathya Gunasekaran \- What's next for the React Compiler?**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qd5yk2gxbtg)

translations.fr: ğŸ¥ [**Sathya Gunasekaran \- Quelle est la suite pour le compilateur React ?**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qd5yk2gxbtg)
translations.en: ğŸ¥ [**Sathya Gunasekaran \- Quel avenir pour le Compilateur React ?**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qd5yk2gxbtg)

segments.source_content: I finally caught up with this great talk that announced the [React compiler beta](https://react.dev/blog/2024/10/21/react-compiler-beta-release), but also unveiled a few other interesting. The compiler is not just about auto-memoization, but is a platform to build more optimizations on. 3 upcoming features presented:

translations.fr: J'ai enfin pris le temps de regarder cette excellente confÃ©rence qui annonce la [version bÃªta du compilateur React](https://react.dev/blog/2024/10/21/react-compiler-beta-release), mais dÃ©voile Ã©galement d'autres aspects intÃ©ressants. Le compilateur ne se limite pas Ã  la mÃ©moÃ¯sation automatique, mais constitue une plateforme pour dÃ©velopper davantage d'optimisations. Trois fonctionnalitÃ©s Ã  venir ont Ã©tÃ© prÃ©sentÃ©es :
translations.en: J'ai enfin pris le temps de regarder cette excellente confÃ©rence annonÃ§ant la [bÃªta du compilateur React](https://react.dev/blog/2024/10/21/react-compiler-beta-release), qui dÃ©voile Ã©galement d'autres aspects intÃ©ressants. Le compilateur ne se limite pas Ã  la mÃ©moÃ¯sation automatique, mais constitue une plateforme pour dÃ©velopper davantage d'optimisations. 3 fonctionnalitÃ©s Ã  venir ont Ã©tÃ© prÃ©sentÃ©es :

segments.source_content:
- Type config: You can help the compiler do a better job by providing extra type information.
- JSX Inlining: The compiler can remove useless JSX runtime calls, replace them with pre-built JSX objects. `jsx('div')` becomes `{type: 'div'}`.
- JSX Outlining: The compiler can extract subcomponents automatically, that can then be optimized independently. This is particularly useful for list elements when using `array.map` and inlined JSX, the compiler can create an `<Item>` component (see the talk screenshot, otherwise [this PR](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/30956) explains it well).

translations.fr:
- Configuration des types : Vous pouvez aider le compilateur Ã  mieux fonctionner en fournissant des informations de type supplÃ©mentaires.
- JSX Inlining : Le compilateur peut supprimer les appels JSX inutiles et les remplacer par des objets JSX prÃ©construits. `jsx('div')` devient `{type: 'div'}`.
- JSX Outlining : Le compilateur peut extraire automatiquement les sous-composants, qui peuvent ensuite Ãªtre optimisÃ©s indÃ©pendamment. Cela est particuliÃ¨rement utile pour les Ã©lÃ©ments de liste lors de l'utilisation de `array.map` et de JSX intÃ©grÃ© ; le compilateur peut crÃ©er un composant `<Item>` (voir la capture d'Ã©cran de la prÃ©sentation, sinon [cette PR](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/30956) l'explique bien).
translations.en:
- Configuration des types : Vous pouvez aider le compilateur Ã  mieux fonctionner en fournissant des informations de type supplÃ©mentaires.
- Inlining JSX : Le compilateur peut supprimer les appels d'exÃ©cution JSX inutiles, les remplacer par des objets JSX prÃ©construits. `jsx('div')` devient `{type: 'div'}`.
- Outlining JSX : Le compilateur peut extraire automatiquement des sous-composants, qui peuvent ensuite Ãªtre optimisÃ©s indÃ©pendamment. Ceci est particuliÃ¨rement utile pour les Ã©lÃ©ments de liste lors de l'utilisation de `array.map` et de JSX intÃ©grÃ©, le compilateur peut crÃ©er un composant `<Item>` (voir la capture d'Ã©cran du talk, sinon [cette PR](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/30956) l'explique bien).

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Omlet â€“ Scan your repos and measure how and where components are used](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-oct-2024)
- ğŸ“œ [Managing Advanced Search Param Filtering in the Next.js App Router](https://aurorascharff.no/posts/managing-advanced-search-param-filtering-next-app-router/): Great interactive article showing that lifting state to the URL is not so easy when using RSC-based routing. To obtain a good UX, you have to use startTransition and useOptimistic. The nuqs library can help simplify.
- ğŸ“œ [Two ways to the two Reacts](https://bobaekang.com/blog/two-ways-to-the-two-reacts/): Interesting thoughts on the different visions that Next.js and TanStack Start are adopting to integrate modern React features. TanStack Start is more client-centric and less disruptive.
- ğŸ“œ [How to (not) reset a form after a Server Action in React](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-server-action-reset-form/): React Actions automatically reset the uncontrolled form inputs, but it might not be what you want on action errors.
- ğŸ“œ [Storybook Test sneak peek](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-test-sneak-peek/): Testing components and stories in your browsers.
- ğŸ“œ [Upgrading React with micro-frontend](https://alexocallaghan.com/upgrading-react-with-microfrontends): Using a Module Federation React bridge to allow using different React versions.
- ğŸ“œ [React Router Brand Update](https://remix.run/blog/react-router-brand-update): Updating the logo/wordmark for the upcoming v7 release.
- ğŸ“œ [How headless components became the future for building UI libraries](https://www.subframe.com/blog/how-headless-components-became-the-future-for-building-ui-libraries): In particular focusing on Radix.
- ğŸ“œ [Integrating Large Language Models into Frontends](https://www.manuelsanchezdev.com/blog/integrating-llm-frontend)
- ğŸ“œ [XState in React: Look Ma, no useState or useEffect\!](https://www.frontendundefined.com/posts/monthly/xstate-in-react/)
- ğŸ“œ [How To Build And Deploy A Headless WordPress With Next.js?](https://scientyficworld.org/how-to-deploy-headless-wordpress-with-next-js/)
- ğŸ“œ [On Crafting Painterly Shaders (React Three Fiber)](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/posts/on-crafting-painterly-shaders/)
- ğŸ“œ [Preact \- Simplifying Islands Architecture](https://preactjs.com/blog/simplifying-islands-arch/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Docusaurus 3.6 \- Docusaurus Faster](https://docusaurus.io/blog/releases/3.6): The project Iâ€™ve been working on for a few months now, upgrading Docusaurus to Rust tooling (Rspack, SWC, LightningCSS) makes it 3x faster to build your static site\!
- ğŸ“¦ [next-validate-link \- Validate Your Markdown Links with Ease](https://next-validate-link.vercel.app/): It understands Next.js (App Router) conventions and reports broken links/anchors found in MD/MDX files.
- ğŸ“¦ [StyleX 0.9.3 \- Improves theming APIs and dynamic styles](https://stylexjs.com/blog/v0.9.3)
- ğŸ“¦ [nuqs 2.1 \- Type-safe search params \- Vitest 2 support, parseAsISODate, serializer urlKeys and clearAsDefaults](https://github.com/47ng/nuqs/releases/tag/v2.1.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [uikit 0.8 \- Performant 3D user interfaces using React-Three-Fiber and Yoga](https://github.com/pmndrs/uikit/releases/tag/v0.8.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Quicky \- Deploy Next.js and Node.js to your own server](https://quicky.dev/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Shopify Hydrogen \- October 2024 release \- Storefront API](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/update/october-2024-release-storefront-api-2024-10)
- ğŸ“¦ [Monicon \- Universal Icon Library](https://monicon-docs.vercel.app/)
- ğŸ¥ [Ethan Niser \- The secret to why React feels so fast](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtotu8p9DWw): More about functional programming than React but still worth watching to understand the underlying techniques that allow Concurrent React to split work into smaller chunks and regularly yield to the main thread.
- ğŸ¥ [Delba \- Next.js 'use cache' in 100 seconds](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OWmRn74CQKY)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [This Month in React \- React Devtools, RN 0.76, Web Components...](https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/reactiflux/episodes/TMiR-2024-10-React-DevTools-update--React-Native-0-76-new-architecture-dropped--Web-Components-arent-the-future-e2qi6bb)

## ğŸ’¸ Sponsor {#sponsor2}
[![Introducing @clerk/nextjs v6 - Next.js 15 compatible](/emails/issues/208/clerk.jpg)](https://go.clerk.com/763LGC2)
**[Introducing @clerk/nextjs v6 - Next.js 15 compatible](https://go.clerk.com/763LGC2)**

The Next.js team has announced the stable release of Next.js 15, and Clerk is continuing the tradition of (nearly) same-day support for new major Next.js releases with the release of `@clerk/nextjs` v6. With v6, the `auth()` helper is now asynchronous, `<ClerkProvider>` defaults to static rendering instead of dynamic, and support for partial pre-rendering has been introduced.

translations.fr: L'Ã©quipe Next.js a annoncÃ© la sortie stable de Next.js 15, et Clerk poursuit la tradition d'un support (presque) le jour mÃªme pour les nouvelles versions majeures de Next.js avec la sortie de `@clerk/nextjs` v6. Avec la v6, l'assistant `auth()` est dÃ©sormais asynchrone, `<ClerkProvider>` utilise par dÃ©faut le rendu statique au lieu du rendu dynamique, et la prise en charge du prÃ©-rendu partiel a Ã©tÃ© introduite.

Avec la v6, l'assistant `auth()` est dÃ©sormais asynchrone, `<ClerkProvider>` utilise par dÃ©faut le rendu statique au lieu du rendu dynamique, et le prÃ©-rendu partiel est pris en charge.

segments.source_content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}
[![React Navigation 7.0](/emails/issues/208/reactnavigation7.jpg)](https://reactnavigation.org/blog/2024/11/06/react-navigation-7.0/)
[**React Navigation 7.0**](https://reactnavigation.org/blog/2024/11/06/react-navigation-7.0/)
React Navigation v7 is now out and should power the upcoming Expo Router v4 coming with Expo SDK 52, both in beta. My favorite highlights are:

translations.fr: React Navigation v7 est dÃ©sormais disponible et devrait alimenter le prochain Expo Router v4 livrÃ© avec Expo SDK 52, tous deux en version bÃªta. Mes points forts prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©s sont :
translations.en: React Navigation v7 est dÃ©sormais disponible et devrait alimenter le prochain Expo Router v4 livrÃ© avec Expo SDK 52, tous deux en version bÃªta. Mes points forts prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©s sont :
translations.zh-hans: React Navigation v7 ç°å·²å‘å¸ƒï¼Œå°†ä¸ºå³å°†éš Expo SDK 52 æ¨å‡ºçš„ Expo Router v4 æä¾›æ”¯æŒï¼ˆä¸¤è€…å‡å¤„äºæµ‹è¯•é˜¶æ®µï¼‰ã€‚æœ€å€¼å¾—å…³æ³¨çš„äº®ç‚¹åŒ…æ‹¬ï¼š

segments.source_content:
- Screen preloading: You can prepare screens ahead of time prior to navigating to them and improve the perceived performance. This one is really exciting and might be able to use Concurrent React features in the future.
- Static API: Simplifies the navigator configuration, and makes it easier to work with TypeScript and deep linking.

translations.fr:
- PrÃ©chargement des Ã©crans : Vous pouvez prÃ©parer les Ã©crans Ã  l'avance avant d'y naviguer et amÃ©liorer les performances perÃ§ues. Celui-ci est vraiment excitant et pourrait utiliser les fonctionnalitÃ©s Concurrent React Ã  l'avenir.
- API Statique : Simplifie la configuration du navigateur et facilite l'utilisation avec TypeScript et le deep linking.
translations.en:
- PrÃ©chargement des Ã©crans : Vous pouvez prÃ©parer les Ã©crans Ã  l'avance avant d'y naviguer et amÃ©liorer les performances perÃ§ues. Celui-ci est vraiment passionnant et pourrait utiliser les fonctionnalitÃ©s Concurrent React Ã  l'avenir.
- API statique : Simplifie la configuration du navigateur et facilite l'utilisation de TypeScript et du deep linking.

segments.source_content: [**We've just finished migrating the Shopify mobile app to React Native**](https://threadreaderapp.com/thread/1853619638141071573.html)

translations.fr: [**Nous venons de terminer la migration de l'application mobile Shopify vers React Native**](https://threadreaderapp.com/thread/1853619638141071573.html)
translations.en: [**Nous venons de terminer la migration de l'application mobile Shopify vers React Native**](https://threadreaderapp.com/thread/1853619638141071573.html)

segments.source_content: Mustafa (Director of Engineering) announced on X that Shopify finished migrating their flagship app with 586 screens to React Native, with very positive results. I hope we'll get a detailed blog post soon.

translations.fr: Mustafa (directeur de l'ingÃ©nierie) a annoncÃ© sur X que Shopify a terminÃ© la migration de son application phare avec 586 Ã©crans vers React Native, avec des rÃ©sultats trÃ¨s positifs. J'espÃ¨re que nous aurons bientÃ´t un article de blog dÃ©taillÃ©.

segments.source_content:
- 1.8 millions of lines of code removed
- 86% of code sharing between iOS and Android
- 59% faster screen loading
- 44% faster app launch
- 63% faster webviews
- Reducing app crashes
- Improving apps store ratings

translations.fr:
- 1,8 million de lignes de code supprimÃ©es
- 86 % de partage de code entre iOS et Android
- 59 % de chargement d'Ã©cran plus rapide
- 44 % de lancement d'application plus rapide
- 63 % de webviews plus rapides
- RÃ©duction des plantages d'application
- AmÃ©lioration des notes des applications dans les stores
